requestState

public PlayerState requestState()
Returns the server stored player state. It is recommended to call this method at the start of each turn to get a fresh view of your units' states. They might have been affected by an opponent's attack action, traps or tower drains. Likewise, you will thus determine the remaining strength and the updated sight for each of your still active towers, as well as any traps that have been sprung.

Specified by:
requestState in interface IPlayerActions
Returns:
the player state as seen by the server application at the moment of inquiry or null if the call is made outside the player's turn

move

public PlayerState move(UnitState unit,
                        Point2i newPosition)
Allows a unit to move to an adjacent cell.

If the transition is successful, the returned player state will have the specified unit moved to the required position.

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Specified by:
move in interface IPlayerActions
Parameters:
unit - the unit to be moved
newPosition - - the movement target position
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.

dig

public PlayerState dig(UnitState unit)
Allows the given unit to dig for resources in the current cell.

If successful, the UnitState of the unit performing the action will have its currentCellResources updated with the resources contained in the currentCell.

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Specified by:
dig in interface IPlayerActions
Parameters:
unit - the unit performing the digging operation
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.

pickupResources

public PlayerState pickupResources(UnitState unit,
                                   java.util.HashMap<ResourceType,java.lang.Integer> desiredResources)
Allows the given unit to pick up the resources contained in the current cell.

If successful, the UnitState of the unit performing the action will have the specified resources added to its carriedResources field.

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Specified by:
pickupResources in interface IPlayerActions
Parameters:
unit - the unit performing the operation
desiredResources - the desired resources and their quantity
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.

pickupObjects

public PlayerState pickupObjects(UnitState unit,
                                 java.util.HashMap<ICarriable,java.lang.Integer> desiredObjects)
Allows the given unit to pick up the crafted objects contained in the current cell. Crafted objects can be picked up from a cell if a unit has previously dropped them there.

If successful, the UnitState of the unit performing the action will have the specified resources added to its carriedObjects field.

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Specified by:
pickupObjects in interface IPlayerActions
Parameters:
unit - the unit performing the operation
desiredObjects - the desired crafted objects and their quantity
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.

dropResources

public PlayerState dropResources(UnitState unit,
                                 java.util.HashMap<ResourceType,java.lang.Integer> unwantedResources)
Allows the given unit to drop the specified quantities of basic resources.

If successful, the UnitState of the unit performing the action will have the specified resource quantities subtracted from its carriedResources field.

The dropped resources will now become visible to other units that pass near the current cell

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Specified by:
dropResources in interface IPlayerActions
Parameters:
unit - the unit executing the drop action
unwantedResources - the unwanted resources and their quantities
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.

                               java.util.HashMap<ICarriable,java.lang.Integer> unwantedObjects)
Allows the given unit to drop the specified quantities of crafted objects.

If successful, the UnitState of the unit performing the action will have the specified object quantities subtracted from its carriedObjects field.

The dropped artifacts will now become visible to other units that pass near the current cell

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

craftObject

public PlayerState craftObject(UnitState unit,
                               Blueprint blueprint)
Allows the given unit to craft the object described in the blueprint using the required ingredients.

If successful, the target object will be added to the unit's carriedObjects field. Also, the unit performing the action will have the ingredient quantities subtracted from its carriedResources / carriedObjects field.

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Specified by:
craftObject in interface IPlayerActions
Parameters:
unit - the unit performing the crafting action
blueprint - the blueprint specifying the type of object that is supposed to be built
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.

equip

public PlayerState equip(UnitState unit,
                         IEquippable target)
Allows the given unit to equip the target crafted object.

If successful, the target object, a sword or an armour, will be equiped.

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Specified by:
equip in interface IPlayerActions
Parameters:
unit - the unit performing the crafting action
target - the armour / sword that is supposed to be equiped
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to equip an invalid object.

placeTower

public PlayerState placeTower(UnitState unit,
                              Blueprint blueprint)
Allows the given unit to place a tower in its current position. The tower must first be built using the ingredients specified in the blueprint that describes the tower strategic object.

If successful, the tower will be placed in the current position of the builder unit. Also, the new tower will be added to the availableTowers field of the returned player state.

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Specified by:
placeTower in interface IPlayerActions
Parameters:
unit - the unit building the tower
blueprint - the blueprint specifying the tower object
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.

placeTrap

public PlayerState placeTrap(UnitState unit,
                             Blueprint blueprint)
Allows the given unit to place a trap in its current position. The trap must first be built using the ingredients specified in the blueprint that describes it.

If successful, the trap will be placed in the current position of the builder unit. Also, the new trap will be added to the availableTraps field of the returned player state.

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Specified by:
placeTrap in interface IPlayerActions
Parameters:
unit - the unit building the trap
blueprint - the blueprint specifying the trap object
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.

attack

public PlayerState attack(UnitState unit,
                          BasicUnit attackedUnit,
                          int energy)
Allows the given unit to attack an enemy unit if it is in its vicinity.

The attack is done by investing as much energy as desired. Damage is done by multiplying this energy with the equipped sword's modifier and enemy's shield modifier: damage = energy * (1 + swordMod) * (1 - shieldMod).

If there's no sword then swordMod = 0. Same for missing armour.

The resulting damage decreases the unit's maxEnergy value, equivalent to unit's life.

The attacked unit had the possibility of preparing for retaliation. In this case and if the unit survives the attack and it has enough energy then a retaliation is done, using the same formula as above.

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure. Otherwise, the returned state will be updated to reflect attack and retaliation.

Specified by:
attack in interface IPlayerActions
Parameters:
unit - the unit doing the attack
attackedUnit - the enemy unit being attacked
energy - the amount of energy points used for damage
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.

prepare

public PlayerState prepare(UnitState unit,
                           int energy,
                           int threshold)
Allows the given unit to prepare for retaliation in the next round should it be placed under attack.

For a description of attack and retaliation @see attack description.

If a unit is attacked multiple times during a round then after each attack there's a possibility for retaliation, as long as there is enough energy. Since each retaliation decreases unit energy, it is desirable to select a minimum energy level after which to stop retaliating.

This action doesn't fail, it just sets up some variables.

Specified by:
prepare in interface IPlayerActions
Parameters:
unit - the unit which prepares for retaliation
energy - the amount of energy invested in one retaliation
threshold - the amount of energy at which the retaliation should stop.

upgrade

public PlayerState upgrade(UnitState unit,
                           Blueprint blueprint)
Performs an upgrade for the given crafted object described by the blueprint by paying the required upgrade cost (available by calling blueprint.getUpgradeCost()) in gold nuggets.

If successful, the PlayerState returned will contain an additional blueprint describing the requirements for the next level of the crafted object.

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Specified by:
upgrade in interface IPlayerActions
Parameters:
unit - the unit performing the upgrade
blueprint - the blueprint that is upgraded
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.
